com.digev.fw.message

Interface MessageSourceProvider

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractMessageSourceProvider, ResourceBundleMessageProvider

    public interface MessageSourceProvider
    A source of formatted and unformatted messages. Implementations will provide the lookup mechanisms, such as from resource bundles or database tables.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getFormattedMessage(java.lang.String key, java.lang.Object[] arguments)
      Returns a message for the supplied key formatted with the supplied arguments.
      java.util.Locale getLocale()
      Returns the locale being used for the MessageSource.
      java.lang.String getPattern(java.lang.String key)
      Returns the pattern for the supplied key.
      java.lang.String substitute(java.lang.String pattern, java.lang.Object[] arguments)
      Returns a formatted message based on the given pattern using the supplied message arguments.

    • Method Detail

      • getFormattedMessage

        java.lang.String getFormattedMessage(java.lang.String key,
                                     java.lang.Object[] arguments)
        Returns a message for the supplied key formatted with the supplied arguments.
        Parameters:
        key - Key of the message to return.
        arguments - Array of objects to be used within the returned message.
        Returns:
        String message formatted with the supplied arguments.

      • getPattern

        java.lang.String getPattern(java.lang.String key)
        Returns the pattern for the supplied key. A pattern is a message that has not been formatted with potential message arguments. The pattern can be used multiple times for the substitute() method if the user would like multiple versions of the same message but with different arguments.
        Parameters:
        key - Key of the pattern to return.
        Returns:
        String pattern for the given key. It is important that if there is no pattern available, the implementation returns null. This allows higher level objects to determine if the implementation can satisfy a given key.

      • substitute

        java.lang.String substitute(java.lang.String pattern,
                            java.lang.Object[] arguments)
        Returns a formatted message based on the given pattern using the supplied message arguments. The message is formatted by substituting placeholders (if any) in the pattern with the supplied arguments.
        Parameters:
        pattern - String pattern to format.
        arguments - Object array of arguments to substitute.
        Returns:
        String message formatted with the supplied arguments.

      • getLocale

        java.util.Locale getLocale()
        Returns the locale being used for the MessageSource.
        Returns:
        Locale of the MessageSource.
